clusters.title: Trump administration plans to deport newly freed Kilmar Abrego Garcia to Uganda
clusters.neutral_headline: US Seeks to Deport Man to Uganda After Wrongful Deportation
bullet_summary: Abrego Garcia reportedly declined a plea deal that would see him deported to Costa Rica
Immigration officials said they intend to deport Kilmar Abrego Garcia to Uganda after he declined an offer to be deported to Costa Rica, according to a Saturday court filing

items.title: Trump administration plans to deport newly freed Kilmar Abrego Garcia to Uganda
items.standfirst: The US government is seeking to deport El Salvadoran national Kilmar Abrego Garcia, who was wrongfully expelled from the US in March before returning to face detention in the US, to Uganda, his defence attorneys said Saturday. Abrego Garcia reportedly declined a plea deal that would see him deported to Costa Rica.
items.content: The US government is seeking to deport El Salvadoran national Kilmar Abrego Garcia, who was wrongfully expelled from the US in March before returning to face detention in the US, to Uganda, his defence attorneys said Saturday. Abrego Garcia reportedly declined a plea deal that would see him deported to Costa Rica.

items.title: Man wrongly deported from US to El Salvador now threatened with deportation to Uganda
items.standfirst: A man who was wrongly deported to El Salvador by the Trump administration has been threatened with removal again, according to a court filing by his lawyers.
items.content: A man who was wrongly deported to El Salvador by the Trump administration has been threatened with removal again, according to a court filing by his lawyers.

items.title: Trump administration seeks to deport Kilmar Abrego Garcia to Uganda

items.content: Abrego Garcia’s case remains a flashpoint in US President Donald Trump’s anti-immigration crackdown.

items.title: US immigration officials intend to deport Kilmar Ábrego García to Uganda
items.standfirst: Salvadorian refused offer of deportation to Costa Rica before he was released to await trial on human smuggling chargesUS immigration officials said they intend to deport Kilmar Ábrego García to Uganda, after he declined an offer to be deported to Costa Rica in exchange for remaining in jail and pleading guilty to human smuggling charges, according to a Saturday court filing.The Costa Rica offer came late on Thursday, after it was clear that the Salvadorian national would probably be released from a Tennessee jail the following day. Continue reading...
items.content: Salvadorian refused offer of deportation to Costa Rica before he was released to await trial on human smuggling chargesUS immigration officials said they intend to deport Kilmar Ábrego García to Uganda, after he declined an offer to be deported to Costa Rica in exchange for remaining in jail and pleading guilty to human smuggling charges, according to a Saturday court filing.The Costa Rica offer came late on Thursday, after it was clear that the Salvadorian national would probably be released from a Tennessee jail the following day. Continue reading...

items.content: The Trump administration may try to deport Kilmar Abrego Garcia to Uganda days after he was released from pre-trial detention, according to a DHS official.

items.standfirst: Rhode Island and Connecticut officials say project, slated to power 350,000 homes, is essential to their climate goalsThe Democratic governors of Rhode Island and Connecticut promised on Saturday to fight a Trump administration order halting work on a nearly complete wind farm off their coasts that was expected to be operational next year.The Revolution Wind project was about 80% complete, with 45 of its 65 turbines already installed, according to the Danish wind farm developer Ørsted, when the US Bureau of Ocean Energy Management sent the firm a letter on Friday ordering it to “halt all ongoing activities”. items.standfirst: Ukraine launched a wave of drone strikes on Russia, triggering a fire at a nuclear power plant as it celebrated Ukrainian independence day against a backdrop of fading hopes for recent peace efforts.The brutal three-and-a-half-year war of attrition, which has killed tens of thousands of people, has ground to a virtual stalemate, though Russia has managed to eke out recent advances in the eastern Donetsk region. For in-depth analysis and a deeper perspective, FRANCE 24's Catherine Viette is pleased to welcome Peter Zalmayev, Director of the Eurasian Democracy Initiative.

clusters.title: Asylum hotel protesters met by counter-demonstrators across UK
clusters.neutral_headline: Protests and Counter-Protests Over Asylum Hotels
bullet_summary: Reported by France24, Al Jazeera

items.title: Asylum hotel protesters met by counter-demonstrators across UK
items.standfirst: Protests against the use of hotels to house asylum seekers took place across the UK, with demonstrators gathering in cities such as Bristol, Liverpool, and London, as well as in Mold, Perth, and County Antrim. In many areas, police intervened to keep rival groups apart as anti-racism campaigners staged counter-demonstrations. The unrest follows a High Court ruling earlier this week that blocked plans to use a hotel in Epping, Essex, for asylum accommodation, prompting several local authorities in England to consider launching their own legal challenges. Simon Moritz and Ethan Hajji tell us more.
items.content: Protests against the use of hotels to house asylum seekers took place across the UK, with demonstrators gathering in cities such as Bristol, Liverpool, and London, as well as in Mold, Perth, and County Antrim. In many areas, police intervened to keep rival groups apart as anti-racism campaigners staged counter-demonstrations. The unrest follows a High Court ruling earlier this week that blocked plans to use a hotel in Epping, Essex, for asylum accommodation, prompting several local authorities in England to consider launching their own legal challenges. Simon Moritz and Ethan Hajji tell us more.

items.standfirst: Charity says footage shows fish being struck repeatedly and at least one child taking part in killing fish Animal welfare campaigners allege that a “harrowing series of welfare abuses” have taken place at one of England’s oldest working trout farms in a tourist hotspot in the Cotswolds, including…
items.content: Charity says footage shows fish being struck repeatedly and at least one child taking part in killing fish Animal welfare campaigners allege that a “harrowing series of welfare abuses” have taken place at one of England’s oldest working trout farms in a tourist hotspot in the Cotswolds, including…

items.title: Trout farm in Cotswolds tourist hotspot accused of welfare abuses
items.standfirst: Exclusive: Charity says footage shows fish being struck repeatedly and at least one child taking part in killing fishAnimal welfare campaigners allege that a “harrowing series of welfare abuses” have taken place at one of England’s oldest working trout farms in a tourist hotspot in the Cotswolds, including the participation of children in killing fish.Animal Equality UK, a charity that works to end cruelty to farmed animals, has released video footage that it claims shows fish being repeatedly beaten with batons, mishandled and left to suffocate by untrained members of the public including a child at Bibury trout farm in Gloucestershire. Continue reading...
items.content: Exclusive: Charity says footage shows fish being struck repeatedly and at least one child taking part in killing fishAnimal welfare campaigners allege that a “harrowing series of welfare abuses” have taken place at one of England’s oldest working trout farms in a tourist hotspot in the Cotswolds, including the participation of children in killing fish.Animal Equality UK, a charity that works to end cruelty to farmed animals, has released video footage that it claims shows fish being repeatedly beaten with batons, mishandled and left to suffocate by untrained members of the public including a child at Bibury trout farm in Gloucestershire. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A charity released footage alleging welfare abuses at a Cotswolds trout farm.
The footage reportedly shows fish being struck and mishandled.
Children were allegedly involved in killing fish at the farm.
Animal welfare campaigners claim "harrowing" abuses occurred.
The farm is one of England's oldest working trout farms.

items.title: UK carmakers claimed leaving EV sales rules unchanged would cost jobs and investment
items.standfirst: BMW, Jaguar Land Rover, Nissan and Toyota lobbied against zero emission vehicle mandate, documents showCarmakers claimed that leaving electric car sales rules unchanged would threaten British jobs and cost them hundreds of millions of pounds, according to documents that show the private lobbying for a slower transition away from fossil fuels.BMW, Jaguar Land Rover, Nissan and Toyota claimed that rules forcing them to sell more electric cars each year would harm investment in the UK, according to responses to proposed changes submitted to the government. The responses were obtained by Fast Charge, a newsletter covering electric cars, and shared with the Guardian. Continue reading...
items.content: BMW, Jaguar Land Rover, Nissan and Toyota lobbied against zero emission vehicle mandate, documents showCarmakers claimed that leaving electric car sales rules unchanged would threaten British jobs and cost them hundreds of millions of pounds, according to documents that show the private lobbying for a slower transition away from fossil fuels.BMW, Jaguar Land Rover, Nissan and Toyota claimed that rules forcing them to sell more electric cars each year would harm investment in the UK, according to responses to proposed changes submitted to the government. The responses were obtained by Fast Charge, a newsletter covering electric cars, and shared with the Guardian. Continue reading...

ai_summary: BMW, Jaguar Land Rover, Nissan, and Toyota lobbied against EV mandates.
They claimed the rules would threaten British jobs.
Carmakers said the rules would cost them hundreds of millions of pounds.
Documents show lobbying for a slower transition from fossil fuels.
Responses were submitted to the government regarding proposed changes.

items.title: Bus carrying junior high football team crashes in Pennsylvania, sending 21 people to hospital
items.standfirst: Bus overturned about 20 miles north of Pittsburgh while carrying players from Aliquippa junior high schoolA bus carrying a junior high football team to a game crashed on Saturday north of Pittsburgh, sending 21 of the 28 people onboard to the hospital, officials said.Twenty-five Aliquippa junior high students and three adults were headed to a game in nearby Gibsonia. The crash occurred in Economy Borough, about 20 miles north of Pittsburgh. Continue reading...

The crash occurred in Economy Borough, about 20 miles north of Pittsburgh. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A bus carrying a junior high football team crashed.
